message:
HTML 5 LocalStorage = Bye Bye Cookies ... WOW

http://galantgeek.com/blog/post/2012/11/24/HTML-5-LocalStorage-=-Bye-Bye-Cookies-WOW.aspx
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message: still the localStorage has some issues ;) if you assign something in http you can't read it on https
mmmmmm ... good point that need to look after , but anyway , if everything is going http got rid of a lot of cookies reading and writing code ;)

and the best part is to organize your local storage stuff and store your data as an object. hope this can be helpful. but one of the amazing things you can do with localStorage is instead of sending data to the server and show loading and this ugly stuff you can save the data in the localStorage and send them in the background :)
